name: Mixed Pickle
history: Mixed Pickle, commonly known as 'Achaar' in India, has a rich history in Indian cuisine. It's a traditional method of preserving various fruits and vegetables with spices, oil, and salt, and is enjoyed for its tangy and spicy flavors.
description: Mixed Pickle is a combination of various diced vegetables and fruits like mangoes, carrots, lemons, and green chilies, pickled with a blend of spices like mustard, fenugreek, and asafoetida in oil. It's a flavorful condiment that complements Indian meals.

instructions.title: Prepare the Vegetables
instructions.description: Mix the diced mango, carrots, lemons, and green chilies in a bowl. Ensure that the vegetables are dried thoroughly after washing.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Oil
instructions.description: Add mustard seeds powder, fenugreek seeds powder, asafoetida, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to the vegetables. Mix well. Pour mustard oil and vinegar over the mixture and stir thoroughly.

instructions.title: Store the Pickle
instructions.description: Transfer the mixture to a clean, dry jar. Ensure the jar is airtight. The pickle should sit in a sunny spot for about a week for the flavors to develop.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: The pickle is ready to eat once the vegetables are softened and have absorbed the spices. It can be served as a condiment with meals.

tips: Make sure all utensils and the jar are completely dry to prevent spoilage.
The pickle's flavor enhances over time.
variations: Add other vegetables like cauliflower or beetroot.
Adjust the spice levels according to your preference.

storage.shelfLife: Can be stored for several months in a cool, dry place.
storage.instructions: Keep the jar tightly closed. Use a dry spoon for serving.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl or directly from the jar.
Accompany with a platter of Indian bread and curries.
